poem:
Title: "Global Pulse"

Into England's health-filled heart, they cross,
From distant shores, in fervour toss.
From India's plains, Portugal's beach, Ghana's green,
Their duty calls, in sterile halls, unseen.

In tender care, these souls from afar,
Heal the land with love's stellar star.
A one in five, like seed sown,
In the firmament of NHS, brightly grown.
